E-11.name: Gas Sensor Open Error
E-11.troubleshooting: Inspect gas sensor wiring and connector. Replace gas sensor if open circuit is confirmed.

E-12.name: Gas Sensor Short Error
E-12.troubleshooting: Check gas sensor wiring for short circuit. Replace sensor if necessary.

E-13.name: Gas Sensor Time Error
E-13.description: Gas sensor did not respond within the maximum allowed time.
E-13.troubleshooting: Inspect gas sensor operation and wiring. Replace sensor if response is abnormal.

E-14.name: Gas Sensor Dry Up / No Load Error
E-14.description: Gas sensor detected dry operation or no load condition.
E-14.troubleshooting: Ensure food is placed properly inside cavity. Inspect gas sensor if issue persists.

E-21.name: Temperature Sensor Open Error
E-21.troubleshooting: Check temperature sensor wiring and resistance. Replace sensor if open.

E-22.name: Temperature Sensor Short Error
E-22.troubleshooting: Inspect sensor wiring for shorts. Replace sensor if required.

E-23.name: Preheating Timeout Error
E-23.description: Preheating was not completed within the specified time due to temperature sensor error.
E-23.troubleshooting: Check temperature sensor operation and heater performance.

E-24.name: Over Temperature Error
E-24.troubleshooting: Inspect temperature sensor, cooling fan, and heater control circuitry.

E-25.name: Micro Cook Temperature Error
E-25.description: Abnormal temperature detected during microwave cooking.
E-25.troubleshooting: Inspect temperature sensor and magnetron operation.

E-26.name: Temperature Rise Error
E-26.description: Temperature did not rise above the fixed AD value within 3 minutes after heater started.
E-26.troubleshooting: Check heater, temperature sensor, and power supply to heating circuit.

E-31.name: Gas Sensor Open Error
E-31.description: Gas sensor open condition detected when HEX value exceeds FF for 5 seconds.
E-31.troubleshooting: Inspect gas sensor wiring and replace sensor if faulty.

E-32.name: Gas Sensor Short Error
E-32.troubleshooting: Check gas sensor wiring and replace sensor if shorted.

E-33.name: Weight Sensor Error
E-33.description: Weight sensor initial HEX value is below 14 for 30 seconds during operation.
E-33.troubleshooting: Inspect weight sensor installation and wiring. Replace sensor if needed.

E-34.name: Weight Sensor Calculation Error
E-34.description: Calculated K value from weight sensor is out of Â±28 HEX range.
E-34.troubleshooting: Check weight sensor calibration and replace sensor if abnormal.

E-35.name: Weight Sensor Calculation Error
E-35.description: Calculated A value is negative during weight sensing operation.
E-35.troubleshooting: Inspect weight sensor and control PCB calculation logic.

E-36.name: Door Open Error
E-36.description: Door opened during sensor cooking operation.
E-36.troubleshooting: Close door firmly and restart cooking. Inspect door switch if error repeats.

E-41.name: Easy/PH Sensor Open Error
E-41.troubleshooting: Inspect Easy/PH sensor wiring and replace sensor if open.

E-42.name: Easy/PH Sensor Short Error
E-42.troubleshooting: Check sensor wiring for short circuit and replace sensor if necessary.

E-43.name: Easy/PH Sensor Time Error
E-43.description: Easy/PH sensor did not respond within the maximum allowed time.
E-43.troubleshooting: Inspect Easy/PH sensor operation and replace if faulty.

E-44.name: Easy/PH Sensor Dry Up Error
E-44.description: Dry-up condition detected by Easy/PH sensor.
E-44.troubleshooting: Ensure food load is correct and inspect sensor operation.

E-45.name: Cooling Error
E-45.description: Cooling system failed to operate properly within 3 minutes.
E-45.troubleshooting: Inspect cooling fan motor, airflow path, and control PCB.

E-46.name: Primary Open Error
E-46.description: Primary sensor open detected during Easy/PH operation.
E-46.troubleshooting: Inspect sensor wiring and replace faulty components.

E-47.name: Door Open Error
E-47.troubleshooting: Close door securely and inspect door switch mechanism.

E-51.name: EEPROM Sense Failure
E-51.description: EEPROM open or sense failure detected.
E-51.troubleshooting: Power reset unit. Replace control PCB if error persists.

E-53.name: EEPROM Read/Write Error
E-53.description: EEPROM read or write operation failed.
E-53.troubleshooting: Power reset unit. Replace control PCB if necessary.

E-54.name: EEPROM Zero Setting Error
E-54.description: EEPROM zero value could not be set correctly.
E-54.troubleshooting: Inspect EEPROM memory and replace control PCB if required.

E-61.name: Humidity Sensor Open Error
E-61.troubleshooting: Inspect humidity sensor wiring and replace sensor if open.

E-62.name: Humidity Sensor Short Error
E-62.troubleshooting: Check sensor wiring for short circuit and replace if necessary.

E-63.name: Humidity Sensor Time Error
E-63.description: Humidity sensor did not respond within the maximum allowed time.
E-63.troubleshooting: Inspect humidity sensor and replace if response is abnormal.

-SE-.name: Key Short Error
-SE-.description: Key input short detected for more than 10 seconds.
-SE-.troubleshooting: Clean control panel and inspect keypad for stuck or shorted keys.

E-01.name: Door Open Error
E-01.description: Door opened when it should not be opened.
E-01.troubleshooting: Inspect door latch and door switch assembly.

E-02.name: Cooking Time Setting Over (MWO)
E-02.description: Maximum cooking time exceeded in Microwave Oven mode.
E-02.troubleshooting: Reduce cooking time and restart operation.

E-03.name: Cooking Time Setting Over (Grill)
E-03.description: Maximum cooking time exceeded in Grill mode.
E-03.troubleshooting: Reduce cooking time and restart operation.

E-04.name: Cooking Time Setting Over (Convection)
E-04.description: Maximum cooking time exceeded in Convection mode.
E-04.troubleshooting: Reduce cooking time and restart operation.

E-05.name: Cooking Time Setting Over (Combination)
E-05.description: Maximum cooking time exceeded in Combination mode.
E-05.troubleshooting: Reduce cooking time and restart operation.

E-06.name: Swing Heater Error
E-06.description: Swing heater stop was not detected for 20 seconds during cooking.
E-06.troubleshooting: Inspect swing heater motor and position sensor.

E-08.name: Spit Insert Error
E-08.description: Microwave cooking started with spit inserted in cavity.
E-08.troubleshooting: Remove spit accessory and restart microwave function.

E-09.name: Damper Error
E-09.description: Damper position was not set correctly within 2 minutes.
E-09.troubleshooting: Inspect damper motor, linkage, and control circuitry.
